column1: supremewave-music 157507825946 "2017-02-21 01:30:23 GMT" https://supremewave-music.tumblr.com/post/157507825946/dirty-laundry-all-time-low-review "SupremeWaveAll Time Low â€“ Dirty Laundry.All Time Low last Friday
column2: released their brand now song â€œDirty Laundryâ€ and played it to the world for the first time on BBC Radio One with Nick Grimshaw.Not long after releasing the song
column5: took to Facebook to write this very personal letter to the fans.â€œA song written in the company of friends
column6: torn apart and stitched back together several times over like all the best relationshipsâ€¦ Itâ€™s about leaving the past where it belongs
column7: and loving the people around you for not only their light
column8: but their darkness too.â€œ""We shot the video with that in mind; inspired by a dream about the ups and downs that make us who we are
column10: but better for itâ€¦ alive and inspired. You can check out the song and watch the video at alltimelow.com . Our good friend Pat Tracy
column11: who directed the â€˜Missing Youâ€™ video helped us bring it to life
column12: and we couldnâ€™t be happier about where the story will go from here. Pay close attention. Â :)â€â€œI hope you all love the song as much as I do. Weâ€™re ecstatic about everything we have lined up this year
column13: and canâ€™t wait to add this one to the set list as we get back out on the road. See you soon!â€Alex goes on to speak about signing to Fueled By Ramen.â€œHere we are. Ten years since our first official full-length debut
column14: (nearly 14 years since we formed this band
column15: ) and weâ€™re lucky enough to be sharing another chapter in the tale of All Time Low with the world. We couldnâ€™t be more grateful than we are right now.â€â€œI hope you can forgive us
column16: because weâ€™ve been keeping secrets.â€â€œSince the beginning of last year
column17: we have officially been signed to Fueled By Ramen records
column18: the very first label we ever showcased for during our senior year of high school. It didnâ€™t work out back then
column19: and thatâ€™s ok (we probably blew it)
column20: but FBR has always felt like a second musical family to us through everything.â€œ ""From Hopeless Records
column23: weâ€™ve come up listening to the bands on the FBR roster
column26: looking forward to the moment when timing and purpose would align
column27: affording us the chance to come in under their wing. So
column28: here we are; a year spent in secret on a new label
column29: writing songs and brainstorming for what comes next. Iâ€™m happy to say that we can finally deliver.â€â€œPs. sending all our love and gratitude to the Hopeless Records family
column30: without whom we wouldnâ€™t be in this position now. Thank you for supporting us and breaking down wall after wall with us as we navigated this wild ride together. You guys have been incredible to work with over the years. Good people go far
column31: which is why you all continue to crush it day in and day out. Thank you.â€Here at SupremeWave
column32: we were not too sure what to think when we first heard Dirty Laundry on Radio One. Lyrically
column33: this certainly sounds like an All Time Low song
column34: with classic Gaskarth lyrics throughout the song. The sound and feel for the song
column36: is certainly different to All Time Lowâ€™s usual sound
column38: with vocal sound effects added to the chorus. But the song certainly becomes more familiar sounding at around 02:15 when the songs suddenly picks up tempo and has a more rock-y feel to it. Some fans may feel a little concerned with the change of sound and new record label
column41: released under a new record label
column42: Interscope. This did not really end that well for All Time Low
column43: with the band leaving after just one album
column44: stating that creative differences was the main reason behind the departure. We think fans shouldnâ€™t feel worried about changing labels as they join a host of fantastic bands already signed to Fueled By Ramen
column46: Panic! at the Disco and Twenty One Pilots. We feel with the band now being in their late 20s
column47: a change in sound was always on the cards and the band has certainly been experimenting here and there with their sound on a few tracks on the previous couple of albums. We are excited for the future of All Time Low
column48: we think you should be as well!" True text
